Issues.Title: Why can I tab into menu and toolbar? And why am I not able to tab out of toolbar?
Issues.Body:
### Description

When I tab through my WFP desktop application (.NET 9.0), I finally reach the menu bar. Next I reach the toolbar. None of these controls should be "tabbable".

Morever, once I entered the toolbar using the tab key, I'm not able to exit the toolbar, no matter how often I press the tab key

![Menu and Toolbar tabs](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/36a768d7-d646-4c14-ba3b-ae9d0ee7671f)


### Reproduction Steps

```xml
<Menu x:Name="MainMenu" IsTabStop="False">
  …
</Menu>

<ToolBar IsTabStop="False">
  …
</ToolBar>
```

### Expected behavior

By default, it should not be possible to tab into a menu bar or a toolbar.

### Actual behavior

See above.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Why can I tab into menu and toolbar? And why am I not able to tab out of toolbar?" (#10550)

Issues.Title: Use shared clipboard code
Issues.Body:
This PR switches to using the shared clipboard code coming from System.Private.Windows.Core and exposes the new typed and JSON APIs.

Removes all code no longer used.

The PR includes the existing refactoring PR. The final commit is the actual clipboard change.
 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/10544)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Use shared clipboard code" (#10544)

Issues.Title: Replace static ImagingCache with instanced WeakReferenceCache<K, V>
Issues.Body:
## Description

Replaces static `ImagingCache` used within `BitmapDecoder` and `BitmapImage` with a more OOP-friendly solution of `WeakReferenceCache<K, V>`, using strongly-typed generic version for WeakRefs and using `Lock` instead of locking on instance.

This behaves the same way as the previous one. And another `ArrayList` definition gone.

## Customer Impact

Cleaner codebase for developers mostly, improved performance/allocs during cleanups.

## Regression

No.

## Testing

Local build.

## Risk

Should be low but review carefully.

 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/10543)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Replace static ImagingCache with instanced WeakReferenceCache<K, V>" (#10543)

Issues.Title: Remove double dictionary lookup for ctor params lookup in WpfKnownType
Issues.Body:
## Description

Removes double dictionary lookup in `LookupPositionalParameters` for `WpfKnownType`. Also pre-allocates the type list.

I've removed the `TryGetValue` one as this it would previously already crash with `KeyNotFoundException` anyways which seems alright I guess, eitherway it doesn't change the behaviour that wasn't an issue to begin with.

## Customer Impact

Improved performance, decreased allocations.

## Regression

No.

## Testing

Local build.

## Risk

Low.

 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/10542)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Remove double dictionary lookup for ctor params lookup in WpfKnownType" (#10542)

Issues.Title: [dotnet-sdk-10.0.100-preview.2.25126.21] Autodesk Revit 2025 pop up error window when opening Dynamo
Issues.Body:
### Description

When run the Autodesk Revit 2025 application with the latest .NET 10 build, it failed to open Dynamo window. It seems caused by the Assembly version conflicts in the App between .NET 8 and .NET 10. Could you please confirm if this issue is in .NET? Thanks.

### Reproduction Steps

**Repro Steps(The machine only has the .NET 10 Preview 2 runtime and set environment variables "DOTNET_ROLL_FORWARD_ON_NO_CANDIDATE_FX=2"）**:

Please get the repro machine form [DevDiv ](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/2409091)
1. Launch Revit 2025.exe.
2. If the “Options” window pops up, click the “Close” button.  
3. Click “New …” button in “FAMILIES” area. 
4. Navigate to Desktop and open file “Mass.rft". 
5. Waiting for model upgrade complete.
6. Go to Manage Tab and click Dynamo.

### Expected behavior

Agreements for Data Collection window will appear.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b6a42b88-e9b3-46d4-a2be-ebddb17f4e71)

After clicking Continue button on Agreements for Data Collection window, the Dynamo window will be opened.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaf261a8-a472-4e91-a0a2-a83a1e55e953)

### Actual behavior

Agreement for Data Collection window and Dynamo window are not pop up, an error window shows with below error message:
```
ProtoCore.Exceptions.CompilerInternalException
   at ProtoCore.Utils.Validity.Assert(Boolean cond)
   at ProtoCore.AssociativeEngine.Utils.IsGlobalScopeDirty(Executable exe)
   at ProtoScript.Runners.LiveRunner.ApplyUpdate()
   at ProtoScript.Runners.LiveRunner.PostExecution()
   at ProtoScript.Runners.LiveRunner.CompileAndExecuteForDeltaExecution(String code)
   at ProtoScript.Runners.LiveRunner.SynchronizeInternal(String code)
   at ProtoScript.Runners.LiveRunner.ResetVMAndResyncGraph(IEnumerable`1 libraries)
   at Dynamo.Engine.LiveRunnerServices.ReloadAllLibraries(IEnumerable`1 libraries)
   at Dynamo.Engine.EngineController.OnLibraryLoaded()
   at Dynamo.Engine.EngineController..ctor(LibraryServices libraryServices, String geometryFactoryFileName, Boolean verboseLogging)
   at Dynamo.Models.DynamoModel.ResetEngineInternal()
   at Dynamo.Models.DynamoModel..ctor(IStartConfiguration config)
   at Dynamo.Applications.Models.RevitDynamoModel..ctor(IRevitStartConfiguration configuration)
   at Dynamo.Applications.Models.RevitDynamoModel.Start(IRevitStartConfiguration configuration)
   at Dynamo.Applications.DynamoRevit.InitializeCoreModel(DynamoRevitCommandData commandData)
   at Dynamo.Applications.DynamoRevit.LoadDynamoWithoutSplashScreen()
   at Dynamo.Applications.DynamoRevit.ExecuteCommand(DynamoRevitCommandData commandData)
```

### Regression?

**Verify Scenarios:**
1). Windows 10 22H2 AMD64 + dotnet-sdk-8.0.406: Pass
2). Windows 10 22H2 AMD64 + dotnet-sdk-10.0.100-preview.2.25126.21: Fail
3). Windows 10 22H2 AMD64 + dotnet-sdk-9.0.200: Fail
4). Windows 10 22H2 AMD64 + dotnet-sdk-10.0.100-preview.1.25120.13: Fail

### Known Workarounds

_No response_

### Configuration

**Application Name**: Autodesk Revit 2025
**OS**： Windows 10 22H2
****CPU:** X64
.NET Build Number:** dotnet-sdk-10.0.100-preview.2.25126.21

### Other information

**Findings:**
When debugging with Windbg, we found below exception captured by Windbg (the full log in Windbg attached as [WindbgLog.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19086983/WindbgLog.txt) ):


```
ModLoad: 0000022a`4e9f0000 0000022a`4ea06000   C:\Program Files\Autodesk\Revit 2025\AddIns\DynamoForRevit\DynamoFeatureFlags\LaunchDarkly.CommonSdk.dll
(3cf4.bbc): CLR exception - code e0434352 (first chance)
(3cf4.bbc): CLR exception - code e0434352 (first chance)
ModLoad: 00007ffd`54dd0000 00007ffd`5500a000   C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App\10.0.0-preview.2.25125.14\Microsoft.DiaSymReader.Native.amd64.dll
ModLoad: 0000022a`4ea10000 0000022a`4ea32000   C:\Program Files\Autodesk\Revit 2025\AddIns\DynamoForRevit\DynamoFeatureFlags\LaunchDarkly.ClientSdk.dll
ModLoad: 0000022a`4ced0000 0000022a`4ceda000   C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App\10.0.0-preview.2.25125.14\System.Xml.ReaderWriter.dll
ModLoad: 00007ffd`914c0000 00007ffd`91c40000   C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App\10.0.0-preview.2.25125.14\System.Private.Xml.dll
ModLoad: 00007ffd`febe0000 00007ffd`fec05000   C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App\10.0.0-preview.2.25125.14\System.Memory.dll
ModLoad: 00007ffd`da720000 00007ffd`da75c000   C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App\10.0.0-preview.2.25125.14\System.Private.Uri.dll
ModLoad: 00007ffe`22890000 00007ffe`22abe000   C:\Windows\SYSTEM32\icu.dll
ModLoad: 00007ffd`5d820000 00007ffd`5d8f4000   C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App\10.0.0-preview.2.25125.14\System.Collections.Immutable.dll
onecore\windows\core\console\open\src\server\devicecomm.cpp(149)\conhost.exe!00007FF61052113B: (caller: 00007FFE2E4B7374) ReturnHr(1) tid(4060) 800700E9 No process is on the other end of the pipe.
(3cf4.1fd8): CLR exception - code e0434352 (first chance)
ntdll!RtlUserThreadStart:
00007ffe`2f01cc70 4883ec78        sub     rsp,78h
```

The application log from the application local app data folder (attached as [journal.0010.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19086987/journal.0010.txt)) shows there are module conflicts between .NET 8 and .NET 10:
```
' 0:< API_SUCCESS { Starting External Application: Dynamo For Revit, Class: Dynamo.Applications.VersionLoader, Vendor : ADSK(Dynamo), Assembly: Revit/DynamoRevitVersionSelector.dll,  Assembly Version: 3.3.0.6523 }
' 0:< API_ERROR { : Assembly version conflict in some references in Autodesk.DynamoPlayerForRevit.Application.dll assembly
'Addin's module System.Runtime of version 8.0.0.0 conflicts with same preloaded module of version 10.0.0.0
'Addin's module System.Runtime.InteropServices of version 8.0.0.0 conflicts with same preloaded module of version 10.0.0.0
'Addin's module System.Linq of version 8.0.0.0 conflicts with same preloaded module of version 10.0.0.0
'Addin's module System.Collections of version 8.0.0.0 conflicts with same preloaded module of version 10.0.0.0
'Addin's module System.Threading of version 8.0.0.0 conflicts with same preloaded module of version 10.0.0.0
'Addin's module PresentationCore of version 8.0.0.0 conflicts with same preloaded module of version 10.0.0.0 }
' 0:< API_SUCCESS { Replacing command id 'ID_PLAYLIST_DYNAMO' CanExecute implementation with implementation from application 'Application Dynamo Player For Revit' dll 'C:\Program Files\Autodesk\Revit 2025\AddIns\DynamoPlayerForRevit\Autodesk.DynamoPlayerForRevit.Application.dll'. }
```

**dotnet info:**

Issues.Title: Regarding Keyboard Arrow Navigation Not Working Properly with Custom Editor in DataGrid Cell Template
Issues.Body:
### Description

Regarding when the DataGrid loads a custom editor into the cell template, performing navigation using the keyboard (such as the left or right arrow keys) does not work properly.

**

[Sample.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19069849/Sample.zip)

**
Start the application with MainWindow2 in App.xaml.cs. Here, the editor is used without the DataGrid, and it works properly there.

For your reference attached the sample please review it.


### Reproduction Steps

**Run the sample.**
Try to enter content into the editor.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4b53092b-8f35-4e58-b986-dd6d7fae5c5f)

Try to navigate the cursor using the right/left arrow keys.
For your reference, the replication procedure video is attached.


### Expected behavior


The cursor should move based on keyboard navigation.


### Actual behavior


The cursor doesn't move based on navigation.


### Regression?

_No response_

### Known Workarounds

_No response_

### Impact

_No response_

_No response_

Issues.Title: [main] Force an x64 runtime install
Issues.Body:
Backport of #10494 to main

Works around an issue where because WPF uses Platform globally as to mean the Target platform, and because this is a default property that arcade uses to install additional runtimes, arcade installs the arm64 runtime on an x64 machine, which breaks when we try to run msbuild in signing. It would also break things if we ever ran testing.

```
<PropertyGroup>
    <Configuration Condition="'$(Configuration)' == ''">Debug</Configuration>
    <Platform Condition="'$(Platform)' == ''">AnyCPU</Platform>
    <PlatformName Condition="'$(PlatformName)' == ''">$(Platform)</PlatformName>
  </PropertyGroup>
```

 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/10525)

Local build + CI + I tested a few apps that uses custom fonts to test this code path.

Issues.Title: Fix DependencyProperty test
Issues.Body:
## Description
Fixes the test failure seen in main currently. This was caused by the switch from xUnit test runner to VSTest test runner introduced in #10514 which changed the order in which test were ran and exposed an existing bug in the tests.

The problem is because the xUnit test runner ran the test `Register_InvokeStringTypeTypeValidateFail_Throws` before `Register_InvokeStringTypeType_Success` and VSTest test runner runs them in inverse order. This causes problem because both test registers a dependency property for the same type with the same property name, the thing is that `Register_InvokeStringTypeTypeValidateFail_Throws` expects the registration to fail and not register the dependency property in the cache while `Register_InvokeStringTypeType_Success` expects the registration to succeed and register the dependency property in the cache. 

When the order is `Register_InvokeStringTypeTypeValidateFail_Throws` -> `Register_InvokeStringTypeType_Success` it's fine because the dependency property is not in the cache for the second test.
When the order is `Register_InvokeStringTypeType_Success` -> `Register_InvokeStringTypeTypeValidateFail_Throws` it fails because  `Register_InvokeStringTypeTypeValidateFail_Throws` fails early because the property is already registered for the second test.

Here's the 2 conflicting dependency property name + type:
https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/009ae5a190fcbd8f730d2f0959a96ffaebe244d5/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/tests/UnitTests/WindowsBase.Tests/System/Windows/DependencyPropertyTests.cs#L19

https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/009ae5a190fcbd8f730d2f0959a96ffaebe244d5/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/tests/UnitTests/WindowsBase.Tests/System/Windows/DependencyPropertyTests.cs#L299-L300

Side note:
We should probably refactor how tests are done for DependencyProperty, this PR is just a patch to fix the current failure. IMO we should have 1 type per tests that register dependency properties, if we don't want to have a mess of types we could possibly create the types at runtime using IL emit.

## Customer Impact
None, tests only.

## Regression
WPF tests regression only.

## Testing
Running the tests locally.

## Risk
Low to none, tests only.
